conclusion: Determine the direction of the light ray when it first exits the prism.
Given: AB = 8 cm, angle OAB = 60 degrees, OA = 2 cm.
Using the Law of Sines in triangle OAB to find OB.
Using Pythagorean theorem in triangle OAB to find OB.
Assume light ray travels perpendicular to AD initially, OB = 2√15.
Determine angle of incidence i when light ray hits AB: i = 30 degrees.
Snell's Law: n1 sin(i) = n2 sin(r).
Calculate angle of refraction r using Snell's Law: r ≈ 20.7 degrees.
Reflection occurs at F with angle of reflection equal to angle of incidence: 20.7 degrees.
Determine angle of incidence at second interface: i' = 30 degrees.
Apply Snell's Law at the second interface.
